learning_outcomes.description: Explain how sound is generated, transmitted, and measured.
Explain how humans hear and common causes of hearing impairment across the lifespan.
Describe how humans maintain balance and common causes of balance impairment across the lifespan.
Describe how humans receive and express speech and language, and common causes of speech and language impairment, across the lifespan.
Describe cognitive processes associated with hearing and common causes of cognitive impairment across the lifespan.

assessments.due_date:
18/03/2025 - 21/03/2025

The practical report must be submitted between 0800 on 18Mar25 and 1600 on 21Mar25.
assessments.task_description: Students will complete one practical report for acoustics and psychoacoustics.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The practical report will require students to perform a series of calculations related to sound including decibels, pressure, intensity, frequency, wavelength, period, speed, & calibrating an audiometer.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: An absolute penalty of 10% per day (or part thereof). For example, a score of 80% for a report submitted 25 hours late would be adjusted to 60% following an absolute penalty of 20% for the report being submitted 2-days (or part thereof) late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
PBL2 quiz 28/04/2025 3:00 pm

PBL3 quiz 28/04/2025 5:00 pm

PBL4 quiz 26/05/2025 5:00 pm

Each PBL quiz is due during the lecture hosting that PBL activity.
assessments.task_description: Students will complete three problem-based learning quizzes for disorders of the auditory system, balance, facial nerve, speech & language, and cognition.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Each PBL quiz is to be submitted directly to the course lecturer immediately upon its completion in the classroom.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final exam in AUDL7113 will contain a mix of question types including multiple choice, multiple answer, true/false, short answer and long answer questions addressing all topics covered in the lectures, practicals and problem-based learning activities. A full description of the exam can be found on the AUDL7113 Course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
